senses.sense_definition: An implement for opening bottles that are sealed by a cork, typically consisting of a spiral metal rod and a handle.

examples.text: I need a <w>corkscrew</w> to open this bottle of wine for dinner.
He searched the kitchen drawer but could not find the <w>corkscrew</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A spiral shape or object resembling the twisting metal part of a bottle opener.

examples.text: A bubble rising rapidly in water describes a spiral closely resembling a <w>corkscrew</w>.
The smoke rose in a thin <w>corkscrew</w> towards the ceiling.

senses.sense_definition: A type of inversion used in roller coasters where the track twists 360 degrees.

examples.text: The roller coaster features a double <w>corkscrew</w> that turns riders upside down.
Riders screamed with excitement as they went through the <w>corkscrew</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A type of sharp, twisting punch in boxing, often thrown from the side.

examples.text: The boxer delivered a powerful <w>corkscrew</w> to his opponent's jaw.
He practiced his <w>corkscrew</w> punch in the gym for hours.

senses.sense_definition: To move or twist in a spiral or winding path.

examples.text: The small plane <w>corkscrewed</w> down through the clouds towards the ground.
The narrow road <w>corkscrews</w> up the steep mountain side.

senses.sense_definition: To cause something to twist or move in a spiral path.

examples.text: The pilot <w>corkscrewed</w> the aircraft to avoid the incoming missile.
He <w>corkscrewed</w> his body through the narrow opening in the cave.

senses.sense_definition: To extract information or consent from someone with difficulty.

examples.text: The police finally <w>corkscrewed</w> a confession out of the suspect after hours of questioning.
I had to <w>corkscrew</w> the secret out of her because she didn't want to tell me.

senses.sense_definition: Having the tightly winding shape of a corkscrew.

examples.text: She has natural <w>corkscrew</w> curls that frame her face perfectly.
We climbed the narrow <w>corkscrew</w> stairs to reach the top of the tower.
